main event: On 4 March 1957 in Erie, Pennsylvania, a ground-visual observation of a bright, inch-long, and down 45 degrees shaped object was reported, moving in and through scattered circulars for 25 minutes.
interesting points: The observation lasted for twenty-five minutes, providing a substantial duration of the sighting.
The object was described as inch-long, bright, and moving in a downward 45-degree direction, indicating a specific trajectory.
The report suggests the possibility of the object being a balloon, based on its description, duration, and up-and-down motion.
Despite the balloon hypothesis, the official conclusion was that no report on file.
Photographs were taken as part of the observation.
sighted object: bright, inch-long, and down 45 degrees shaped object
